IX.ii.1.B.4.a
.
Award and Notification Action to Take When No Evidence Is Submitted for Reconsideration of A&A
Use the table below to determine the action to take after the 65 date notice of proposed adverse action period.
If ...
Then ...
no medical evidence was submitted and A&A was established due to nursing home care
reduce or discontinue benefits, as appropriate, without referral to the rating activity
determine the effective date of the award action as outlined in
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart ii, 1.B.4.b
, and
notify the claimant of the decision as provided in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 1.B.1.b
.
Note
:  Do not create an overpayment in connection with the loss of A&A status.
additional medical evidence is received or the claims folder contains a rating decision proposing to discontinue A&A
refer the case to the rating activity.
Reference
:  For more information on referring cases to the rating activity, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart ii, 1.B.4.c
.
